recommendations: Nikita Santoki ‚ÄúI was particularly impressed with Hitesh's cognitive and analytical skills to figure the way out and get people on board. Not just in his professionalism and demeanor, but in his clear understanding of how to approach who, with what storyline, etc helped me develop my skills and confidence. The success achieved so far in his role required extensive knowledge and dedication and I thoroughly appreciate my collaboration with him.‚Äù

experience.title: Cloud Architect Manager
experience.description: Gurpreet is seasoned IT Solution Architect having specialized in Public and Hybrid Cloud Solutioning. Gurpreet is Amazon AWS PROFESSIONAL Level Certified Solution Architect and Microsoft Azure Certified Architect with over 17 years of experience in designing and implementation of IT Infrastructure at in-house data-center, public cloud, Private Cloud and Hybrid Cloud Solution.Gurpreet is passionate about designing an Architecture of IT Infrastructure for the Customers across the globe. While working with customer, LOB and CxO management to develop an accurate understanding of business needs.Cloud Build Services - Advising Clients about Private Cloud, Detailed assessment of client environment and recommending roadmap, designing and implementing private cloud (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS).Excellent knowledge of Amazon Cloud Services like EC2, EFS, RDS, DynamoDB, ELB, VPC and SWF. Managing highly complex & large IT Infrastructure with physical, Virtual and Cloud environment. Worked on various projects on hardware migration, consolidation, software upgrade and network/backup. Having worked directly with customers, business teams, Technical Solutions Architect and Program / Project Management team, to provide technical solutions.
experience.description_html:
Gurpreet is seasoned IT Solution Architect having specialized in Public and Hybrid Cloud Solutioning. Gurpreet is Amazon AWS PROFESSIONAL Level Certified Solution Architect and Microsoft Azure Certified Architect with over 17 years of experience in designing and implementation of IT Infrastructure at in-house data-center, public cloud, Private Cloud and Hybrid Cloud Solution.

Gurpreet is passionate about designing an Architecture of IT Infrastructure for the Customers across the globe. While working with customer, LOB and CxO management to develop an accurate understanding of business needs.

Cloud Build Services - Advising Clients about Private Cloud, Detailed assessment of client environment and recommending roadmap, designing and implementing private cloud (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS).

Excellent knowledge of Amazon Cloud Services like EC2, EFS, RDS, DynamoDB, ELB, VPC and SWF. Managing highly complex & large IT Infrastructure with physical, Virtual and Cloud environment. Worked on various projects on hardware migration, consolidation, software upgrade and network/backup. Having worked directly with customers, business teams, Technical Solutions Architect and Program / Project Management team, to provide technical solutions.

 Introduced & Implemented Outside Branch Model by bringing in Merchant Tie ups; Airport Counters etc.
 Introduced the ERM Model with the Alternate Channel for retention & Cross Sell

projects.title: Work from Home implementation in ICICI Bank
projects.description: Conceptualized and implemented iWork@home, a ‚Äòfirst of its kind‚Äô program, launched on International women‚Äôs day by the MD &CEO, allowing women employees to work from home. The initiative helps the Bank‚Äôs women employees overcome challenges that many of them face at certain life stages. This unique program, replicates the work environment at home by providing employees access to their work applications in a safe and secure manner‚Ä¢The main features of iWork@home initiative are: oIt allows women employees in core functions like ‚ÄòOperations‚Äô to work from home. oA 3-level security protocol ensures that only the concerned employee is able to access the system. A unique facial recognition technology ensures that no one can impersonate the employee and get access to the applications.

I also work closely with the reinsurers in National and International market for securitizing the entire portfolio. I am also responsible for setting up of the entire policy issuance, premium collection, policy-monitoring and claims settlement process and to conceptualise and design technological solutions for business support

positions.subtitle: ICICI Lombard
positions.description: Being a part of the initial team which started weather insurance in India, I was responsible for setting up and stabilizing the Weather Insurance underwriting and claims teams. Being a niche product, I had specifically focused on managing and enhancing the quality of the data bank, comprehensive crop research to study the crop growth pattern and impact of weather on the same, carrying out detailed risk analysis using statistical modelling tools to underwrite the contracts and determine premium rates. I had closely worked with select reinsurers to transfer the risks on facultative basis during the initial years.

detailed_profile.about: Over the last 20 years (primarily in Europe), I have been in ‚Äúentrepreneurial‚Äù roles at ICICI Bank ‚Äì setting up the German branch, managing Europe-wide back office operations and later heading the pan-European retail banking business initiative. Presently, part of a growing fintech Expatrio, responsible for the South Asia market, creating a financial ecosystem for Germany-bound students and skilled migrants. Key Accomplishments: # Laid down the strategy for ICICI Bank Germany for Retail, wholesale remittances and Trade business and designed digital ecosystems around the same # Engage with regulators, local authorities, and consultants and represent the bank as a speaker and panelist in various external forums # Partnered with startups, tech firms, and Fintechs, explored business opportunities and designed tailor-made solutions # Executed large technology projects, increasing operational efficiency with an industry-leading cost-to-income ratio # Established offshore and nearshore delivery models, maximizing outsourcing of noncritical roles

volunteer_experience.info: The Indo-German Centre for Business Excellence (IGC) is a think tank, research centre, and network that connects people and organizations interested in business relations between India and Germany. As an academic institution, it is independent and impartial but always close to the real world. It was founded in 2021 at Frankfurt School of Finance & Management and is a registered association under German law (‚Äúeingetragener Verein‚Äù) with non-profit tax status.

detailed_profile.position: Business Head at ICICI Bank UK PLC
detailed_profile.about: Retail and Commercial banking business professional with 20 +years of experience. I have worked across business verticals to deliver scale, profitability and operational efficiency. # Retail Banking # Trade Finance # Banking operations # Wealth management # Start up ecosystem # Corporate Ecosystem My skills include : # Public speaking and conducting customer forums across segments. # Creating successful relationship business for bank. # Scaling business across product lines # Create new streams of revenue # Digital migration of customers through early digital adoption. # Executing organisational strategy to improve market share and operating profit. Business turn around story board: # Asset operations shop # Retail banking @ Mumbai metropolitan region # Trade finance @ NCR # Start up ecosystem @ NCR & MMR # SME lending @ NCR & MMR # Digital adoption @ trade finance # Corporate Ecosystem # Employee productivity enhancement Key Recognition: ‚Ä¢Awarded ICICI Bank DNA exemplar for leading change in areas of SME Banking and trade finance. ‚Ä¢Awarded ICICI Bank DNA Anchor Award 3 times for Organizational Capability and won the Directors Award multiple times for Business process re-engineering and cross sell. Pro-active decision maker with excellent entrepreneurial skills. I am early technology adopter and firmly believe that all transactional activities should be moved digital. My passion is meeting customers across segments and offering them 360 solutions.

positions.description: ‚Ä¢Responsible for managing self-employed segment banking for North India with total current account deposit base of 6000cr across 1000 branches.‚Ä¢North India has total asset book of 2000cr created in last 2 years through SME and Mid Corporate lending.‚Ä¢North India contributes to 35% of trade fee for ICICI Bank.‚Ä¢Team size of 400 Relationship managers and servicing officers‚Ä¢Role includes acquisition of self-employed customers across industries through lending and liability products.‚Ä¢Specialize in offering various business banking solutions like SME lending, Cash management and treasury advisory.‚Ä¢SME lending solutions ranging from 1cr to 200cr in form of working capital, term loans, packing credit and derivatives.‚Ä¢Execution of Micro market strategy for lending and trade finance across North India.‚Ä¢Key account management through a team of Relationship managers across all service segments including wealth management and private banking.‚Ä¢Efficient execution sales process across all sourcing channels using sales CRM and TAB banking tools.‚Ä¢Handling of service and compliance for self-employed segment at branches.
positions.title: Zonal Head Trade Finance and Business Banking -North India
positions.description_html:
•Responsible for managing self-employed segment banking for North India with total current account deposit base of 6000cr across 1000 branches.
•North India has total asset book of 2000cr created in last 2 years through SME and Mid Corporate lending.
•North India contributes to 35% of trade fee for ICICI Bank.
•Team size of 400 Relationship managers and servicing officers
•Role includes acquisition of self-employed customers across industries through lending and liability products.
•Specialize in offering various business banking solutions like SME lending, Cash management and treasury advisory.
•SME lending solutions ranging from 1cr to 200cr in form of working capital, term loans, packing credit and derivatives.
•Execution of Micro market strategy for lending and trade finance across North India.
•Key account management through a team of Relationship managers across all service segments including wealth management and private banking.
•Efficient execution sales process across all sourcing channels using sales CRM and TAB banking tools.
•Handling of service and compliance for self-employed segment at branches.

positions.subtitle: ICICI Bank
positions.description: Joined ICICI Bank 2001 in Retail banking Operations and then moved to Retail banking branch in 2008.Worked as cluster head and was promoted to Regional head Retail and commercial banking in 2009.Managed a team of 500 employees at 35 retail banking branches with a total Deposit base of INR 7000cr along with an active customer base of over 5 lac. Accountable for service delivery, compliance and sales of assets and liability products, handling direct sales channel team of 200 employees for sourcing assets as well as liability products. I also manage relationship channel of privilege banker ensuring to excellent service that results in customer delight and revenue maximization. In my early career, I worked in various departments in Operations both Asset as well as liability products and instrumentally laid down the processes and service architecture. I was stellar in establishing Centralized Process Centre for asset productsSuccessfully contributed in designing the training and operating system architecture.I have been recognized for consistently achieving Top ratings in annual performance appraisals and hold credentials in obtaining 7 promotions year on year since joining as a Senior officer to Deputy general manager within a span of 11 years. Instrumental in increasing banks foot print in Mumbai by establishing 40 new branches and over 200 ATMI also established acquisition and solution framework for E commerce industry for ICICI bank in Mumbai. Part of core team to successfully re engineer ICICI bank product solution to meet E commerce customers' needs.
positions.title: Regional Head Retail & Business Banking
positions.description_html:
Joined ICICI Bank 2001 in Retail banking Operations and then moved to Retail banking branch in 2008.
Worked as cluster head and was promoted to Regional head Retail and commercial banking in 2009.
Managed a team of 500 employees at 35 retail banking branches with a total Deposit base of INR 7000cr along with an active customer base of over 5 lac. Accountable for service delivery, compliance and sales of assets and liability products, handling direct sales channel team of 200 employees for sourcing assets as well as liability products. I also manage relationship channel of privilege banker ensuring to excellent service that results in customer delight and revenue maximization.

In my early career, I worked in various departments in Operations both Asset as well as liability products and instrumentally laid down the processes and service architecture. I was stellar in establishing Centralized Process Centre for asset productsSuccessfully contributed in designing the training and operating system architecture.

I have been recognized for consistently achieving Top ratings in annual performance appraisals and hold credentials in obtaining 7 promotions year on year since joining as a Senior officer to Deputy general manager within a span of 11 years.
Instrumental in increasing banks foot print in Mumbai by establishing 40 new branches and over 200 ATM
I also established acquisition and solution framework for E commerce industry for ICICI bank in Mumbai. Part of core team to successfully re engineer ICICI bank product solution to meet E commerce customers' needs.

recommendations: Tanul Nishit ‚ÄúSudipto has been for many including me, someone, who defined how a supervisor and leader should be like. Not one to say ‚Äúyou do it‚Äù but someone who always believed in ‚Äúlet‚Äôs do it‚Äù. It was my sheer pleasure to work under him at the start of my career and though I have always been amongst the first few to reach office, very rarely I would have beaten Sudipto on this. It has been truly amazing to have a chance to work with someone like him. Thanks Mr. Nag for all the support. ‚Äù

detailed_profile.name: Manish Jain
detailed_profile.position: State Head Rajasthan at ICICI Bank
detailed_profile.about: Associated with ICICI Bank since Aug 2001. In addition to being a corporate banking RM for first 3.5 years, have been in treasury since 2005 -2015. I have led teams in treasury sales providing risk management solutions to large & midcaps corporates in India and instutional clients. Handled clients across geography within (East, West and South) India and outside India (Asia, GCC, Africa and Australia), strategy and processes implementation across the Bank in Treasury. Moved in 2015 as Deputy Zonal Manager- Corporate Banking Group in ICICI Bank Wholesale Banking, handling large corporates of Mumbai, West zone. Since June 2017 heading the Capital Markets and Custody Department for ICICI BANK.

basic_info.search_snippet: Head of Retail Policy@ICICI Bank | MBA with 22 years exp in Retail & digital lending, Portfolio mgt and retail banking strategy | I write on Economics, ...

detailed_profile.name: Anshuman ji
detailed_profile.position: Head of Retail Policy@ICICI Bank | MBA with 22 years exp in Retail & digital lending, Portfolio mgt and retail banking strategy | I write on Economics, finance, psychology, behavioural finance etc | 2 mn impressions
detailed_profile.about: I am the Head of Retail Policy at ICICI Bank, where I manage the policy and digital lending for all retail products, such as mortgage, auto, unsecured, cards, commercial business, rural, market strategy, service delivery, and various ecosystems. I have over 21 years of experience in banking and finance, with a MBA in finance and financial management services from IBS Hyderabad. My core competencies include retail lending, financial risk management, portfolio quality control, policy formation, creating a profitable business line understanding market dynamics and consumer behaviour. I have worked in almost all large geographies of India in leadership roles, including retail credit head for north India and zonal credit head for mortgages for west and South India. I have also contributed to multiple publications and blogs on banking and finance, real estate, economics, digitization, and innovation. I am passionate about creating value for customers, stakeholders, and society through my work. I also love travel, history, and philosophy. I share my perspective around thought which matters to me and society at large. All my comments are in my personal capacity and not related to the job and organisation.

recommendations: Dhwani Sharma ‚ÄúI feel truly blessed to have had the opportunity to work under Anshuman Sir‚Äôs leadership. He is an exceptional leader who inspires confidence and drives excellence in his team. I have learned so much from him, not only about underwriting but also about the importance of understanding the market deeply. His practical approach to problem-solving and his ability to provide new insights during discussions are remarkable. Anshuman Sir‚Äôs complete knowledge of the market is unparalleled, and one key lesson I have learned from him is that market knowledge is the cornerstone of effective underwriting. It has been a privilege to work with such a knowledgeable and inspiring leader, and I‚Äôm grateful for all the learning and growth I‚Äôve experienced under his guidance.‚Äù

Jasminder Chahal ‚ÄúI've known Anshumanji for 16 years, watching him excel in various roles - credit, business, policy, and risk. I highly recommend Anshumanji for his expertise, adaptability, and collaborative spirit.‚Äù

basic_info.name: Shreya Dev - Retail Regional Head, Bilaspur, ICICI Bank.
basic_info.search_snippet: I am a seasoned banker with close to 15 years of experience in the sector, across functions and geographies in India. I joined ICICI Bank in July 2023.

detailed_profile.name: Shreya Dev
detailed_profile.position: Retail Regional Head, Bilaspur, ICICI Bank.
detailed_profile.about: I am a seasoned banker with close to 15 years of experience in the sector, across functions and geographies in India. I joined ICICI Bank in July 2023, and currently serve as Retail Regional Head, Bilaspur Region. In the last two years at ICICI I have had extensive exposure to Retail Banking, Trade Finance and MSME lending as a Regional Head. For 13 years before that, I was working in South Indian Bank, which was my first job. My last assignment there was of a Cluster Head, heading a cluster of 9 branches in Kolkata, looking after both asset and liability functions of my branches. In my cumulative experience so far, I have been an instrumental part of teams in closing high value deals for my organisation(s), handled operations of large branches, headed branches, then a cluster, and now a Region. And I have liased with countless people along the way - customers in all shapes and sizes, role model colleagues and sometimes very difficult ones too, new joinees with fresh ideas and senior colleagues rich with experience, the police, advocates, local municipal bodies, government representatives, small entrepreneurs, large industrialists...the list could go on. All in all, my job has taught me that I love meeting new people, solving problems on the go, and identifying opportunities for new businesses. And that I have an entrepreneurial spirit. I am willing to learn, unlearn and relearn and I am always up for taking calculated, meaningful risks. And I am good at holding conversations. In my journey so far, I think I know enough to realise that one can never know it all in this industry, but one can keep trying!

detailed_profile.name: Rajneesh Gupta
detailed_profile.position: Zonal Head - North, Markets Group at ICICI Bank
detailed_profile.about: Senior Banking and Treasury professional with over 2 decades of rich experience in Banks / financial services industry. Led coverage for Banks' financial markets business and worked extensively with corporate India in meeting their financing and hedging requirements. Instrumental in successfully building a scalable financial markets business for a new Bank. Previous assignment was with a digital NBFC as part of management team with primary responsibility of treasury / financing, partnerships and investor relations. Valuable international exposure in GE corporate treasury with hands-on experience in foreign exchange risk management, cross-border funding and liquidity management for diverse GE businesses. Holistic understanding of Wholesale Banking, Trade Finance, Treasury and Risk Management.

detailed_profile.name: Harsh Vardhan Nathany
detailed_profile.position: Leadership Team Member, ICICI Bank
detailed_profile.about: Through my extensive education in the competitive fields of CA, CFA, CS, CWA and B Com, I have gained knowledge in various core fields of accounts, finance, company law, costing and investment management. My education demonstrates my learning skills, retention abilities and intelligence. I completed my main education and joined full time employment at the young age of 21 years. Starting early has helped me in gaining higher experience than my peers and to implement my learnings in the latter part of my career. I continued my studies and have a constant desire to keep learning and developing my skillset. My 12 years of work experience in a highly demanding organization like ICICI also demonstrates my loyalty, patience and dedication towards my employers. My experience in ICICI has taught me how to plan and deliver results under pressure while meeting progressively higher expectations. Through my journey, I have crossed many hurdles including a constantly evolving landscape, internal competition, human resource challenges etc. I believe my primary strength is my ‚ÄòSales through relationship‚Äô skills and service orientation towards my customers. I have always considered my clients' issues as my own and passionately represented them within the Bank. This has helped me in building long lasting relationships with my clients and helped in growing my organization's business manifolds over the last decade. I have gained a deep understanding of the financing requirements of an MSME which helps me in structuring deals in a manner which is beneficial to the customer while meeting the norms of the Bank. This fuels my ability to convince clients to accept our product or services I also have a humbling sense of responsibility while taking credit decisions since we are the custodians of public money. I have developed certain basic principles of lending which helps in quick credit selection and give me strong conviction to then onboard the customer crossing all internal and external hurdles with end to end planning. I have also experienced the difficulties of handling clients in stress and also navigating the recovery process through our tough legal system. I realize the critical need to identify early warning signals and importance of decisive early action.

publications.title: Expected Credit Loss Estimation: Embedding the Forecasts of Future Economic Conditions as per IFRS 9 Guideline
publications.subtitle: Prajnan - NIBM
publications.description: This paper evaluates few of the popular approaches used for estimatingExpected Credit Loss (ECL) by embedding the forecasts of futureeconomic conditions as per IFRS 9 requirement. It is argued thatalthough existing literature suggests superior performance of reducedform model over structural model, for individual financial institutions,developing reduced form model can be a challenge due to:(a) Difficulty in modeling linkage between macro-economic indicatorsand portfolio delinquency (especially for retail portfolio)(b) Forecasting of future macro-economic scenarios which are oftensubjective and may significantly differ across similar institutions.A generalized version of the structural model is presented which canincorporate variation in default rate due to credit rating grades andcorrelation parameter is jointly calibrated along with the unobservablefactor. It is possible to incorporate macro-economic factors in this modeland can be applied to both retail and corporate portfolio.

publications.title: Dilution of voting right and market for corporate control
publications.description: In a takeover raid, it has been observed that inefficient takeovers do take place. Corporatecharter often provide various takeover defenses, such as super-majority amendments,staggered boards, fair price amendments, and poison pills which makes change in control virtuallyimpossible. Anti takeover defenses are widely disputed as anti investor. Empiricallyit has observed that it has a negative influence on firm value. However as it also deters inefficientraider from taking over the firm, it has been often argued in favor of these measures.In this paper I will show that if in a takeover, raider offers to buy 50% of the voting stockand also commits to dilute her voting stake once she gets control, can stop inefficient raids.If such dilution of voting right is allowed then incumbent management does not need costlytakeover defense strategies to retain control. This mechanism is ex ante efficient, because itremoves the need for costly takeover defense methods and it is ex post efficient also, as itenables only the good raider to takeover the firm.

detailed_profile.name: Atul Agnihotri
detailed_profile.position: Head-Treasury IT Systems | ICICI Bank
detailed_profile.about: * 23+ years of experience in IT industry *Steered various automation projects in Treasury, Human Resources, Payroll, Infra Services and Compliance functions *A competent professional with rich experience in steering large engagements and with notable success in leading design, development and delivery of complex IT Projects and Solutions *Spearheaded planning and budgeting of IT operational and Capital costs, Technology implementation, transition and service delivery *Merit of defining, leading and developing the product and IT roadmaps to highlight key milestones while creating project deliverables and defining requirements, scope, duration and cost of projects *A transformational leader, steering the development and execution of an IT Strategy, focused on turning IT into a strategic enabler for the businesses with substantial incremental savings in operating expense *Proven success in end-to-end Program Management and Excellence in automating Business Processes, improving the efficiencies and reducing TAT/cost to enhance customer experience *Expertise in concepts of end-to-end software delivery planning and implementation from scope management, to activity sequencing, cost estimation, risk analysis to quality management in line with international guidelines and norms *An effective communicator with excellent relationship management and strong analytical, problem-solving & organizational skills * An astute planner and leader with exemplary Communication, Relationship Management, Team Management, Vendor Management, Analytical and Organizational skills * Experience of working with cross-cultural teams in various locations such as Japan, USA and Taiwan * Motivation: Ability to motivate Employees to perform to their maximum potential * MBA from SP Jain Institute of Global Management, B. Tech in Electronics Engineering from HBTI Kanpur

detailed_profile.name: Anuj Bhargava
detailed_profile.position: Head Global Clients Group, MNCs, PSUs@ ICICI Bank | Financial Management
detailed_profile.about: With over 25 years of experience in the banking and finance sector, I head the Global & Multinational Clients Group at ICICI Bank, one of the largest and most respected banks in India. I have been instrumental in driving the bank's growth, innovation, and digital transformation, while maintaining the highest standards of quality, ethics, and customer satisfaction. I have a Bachelor of Commerce degree from Sydenham College of Commerce and Economics, and I have acquired a range of skills and competencies in the field, such as financial analysis, project management, leadership, and communication. I am passionate about creating value for the bank, its stakeholders, and its customers, and I am always eager to learn new things and collaborate with diverse teams. I aspire to contribute to the bank's vision of becoming a global leader in banking and finance, and to make a positive impact on the society and the environment.

detailed_profile.name: Shaunak D. Joshi
detailed_profile.position: Marketing Head Business Banking & International Banking and Head Strategic Alliances
detailed_profile.about: 'Out-of-the-box thinking'‚Äã and 'People Leadership' are perhaps the words that I would like to associate my 18 years of work in marketing, brand management and advertising. Yes, probably it works. I feel humbled by creating a Guinness World Record through the customer engagement program that we launched for ICICI Bank. Or the marketing idea that generated participation from over 15 lakh people! The business impact thus, can only be imagined (Yes, of course it's been calculated in a spreadsheet). Over the years, I have learnt that people are the primary assets where one needs to invest substantially. Everything else will fall in place. Apart from my team members, who really create magic, the other thing I strongly believe in, is the equation: Business = Marketing. Few things that I can do reasonably well are: - Keep the people working with me happy and motivated - The vision to dream big, think different and passionately execute - Strategic Brand Planning & Communication - Brand Identity Development - New Product Launch & Customer Acquisition - Digital Sales - Customer Engagement Program - Media Planning & Buying - Brand Partnerships and tie-ups I practice the above while managing marketing and advertising for various industries, viz FMCG, pharma, media, real estate and now BFSI.

positions.subtitle: ICICI Bank
positions.description: One of the important tasks on hand was to make the dormant salary account customers of ICICI Bank active with the Bank. To address this, I launched a customer engagement program called 'Meet Amitabh'‚Äã. This online quiz contest offered the customers once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to meet Mr. Bachchan in person if they performed certain banking transactions with us. Eureka! We had around 2 lakh customers who participated in this contest. And the icing on the cake - We created Guinnes world Record!To reduce the cost per transaction, we are the first bank in India to launch round-the-clock automated branch banking concept called 24x7 Touch Banking Branch. As one of the core team members, I was involved in launching the first 100 branches across the country. Set up an interactive website for our customers to understand this concept sitting at home so that they are not intimidated to try it out. Today, over 40% of routine transactions are migrated to automated branch.To discourage our customers from using other banks' ATMs, I regularly launched customer promotions. The promos were simple - Use only ICICI Bank ATMs during the promo period and you can win mega prizes like car, mobile phones, etc. Supported by on-ground and digital communication these promos discouraged over 14 lakh customer transactions from going to other bank! What better, the customer prizes and celebrity endorsements for this promotion were fully sponsored. Courtesy the brand tie-ups by our partnerships team.
positions.title: Head Marketing: Branch Banking, ATMs, Salary Accounts & Personal Loans
positions.description_html:
One of the important tasks on hand was to make the dormant salary account customers of ICICI Bank active with the Bank. To address this, I launched a customer engagement program called 'Meet Amitabh'​. This online quiz contest offered the customers once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to meet Mr. Bachchan in person if they performed certain banking transactions with us. Eureka! We had around 2 lakh customers who participated in this contest. And the icing on the cake - We created Guinnes world Record!

To reduce the cost per transaction, we are the first bank in India to launch round-the-clock automated branch banking concept called 24x7 Touch Banking Branch. As one of the core team members, I was involved in launching the first 100 branches across the country. Set up an interactive website for our customers to understand this concept sitting at home so that they are not intimidated to try it out. Today, over 40% of routine transactions are migrated to automated branch.

To discourage our customers from using other banks' ATMs, I regularly launched customer promotions. The promos were simple - Use only ICICI Bank ATMs during the promo period and you can win mega prizes like car, mobile phones, etc. Supported by on-ground and digital communication these promos discouraged over 14 lakh customer transactions from going to other bank! What better, the customer prizes and celebrity endorsements for this promotion were fully sponsored. Courtesy the brand tie-ups by our partnerships team.

positions.subtitle: ICICI Bank
positions.description: I was responsible for new customer acquisition, creating a market among youth and teenagers and deepening the relationship among the existing customers for the entire range of Savings Accounts and Current Accounts. Savings Account is the largest customer portfolio within the bank, comprising of more than 1.4 Crore account holders. Apart from periodic customer acquisition campaigns, I organised a nation-wide school contact and financial literacy program covering over 150 schools across the country. This covered over 1 lakh students and 10% conversion.Organised India's biggest awards for SMEs - Emerging India Awards in association with CNBC to recognise the achievements of SMEs and position ICICI Bank as a preferred partner for Business Banking. Generated participation from over 2 lakh SMEs resulting into 25,000 new customer acquisition.

detailed_profile.about: Greetings! I am Vanshika, an ambitious and driven individual working with ICICI Bank in the Risk Group. I have an MBA from IIM Bodh Gaya and a BBA from NMIMS. With a strong background in finance and a keen interest in business management, I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills to excel in the corporate world. Throughout my journey, I have developed a reputation for being a compassionate and optimistic person who thrives on meeting and working with people. One of my key strengths lies in problem-solving, I thoroughly enjoy tackling challenges head-on, analyzing issues and devising prompt and innovative solutions. An avid learner at heart, I approach every new challenge with a positive attitude, eager to acquire new skills and knowledge. I believe that continuous learning is the key to personal and professional growth, and I am always open to expanding my horizons and embracing new experiences. I thrive in dynamic environments that encourage creativity, adaptability, and a growth mindset. If you have a story to share or an exciting opportunity to discuss, please feel free to reach out. I am always enthusiastic about engaging and exploring new possibilities. Thank you for visiting my LinkedIn profile. I look forward to connecting with you and building mutually beneficial relationships that drive success and create a positive impact.

recommendations: Sanjeev J. ‚ÄúThis was during those days while I was a part of Retail Assets Ops Group of ICICI Bank (Hyd) that I remember working with Rahul, who was heading the retail bank branch at Begumpet (Hyd). Being a part of RAOG, my job also comprised liaising with credit cards team (phone banking), and collections team. I must admit, I was shocked and surprised to see Rahul's active interest in getting his customers' CC issues resolved. Shocked since I have not seen any other senior leader come up to me to check and get things sorted out. Surprised since it was not part of his deliverables and it was rather easy for him to direct them to CC dept/phone banking which he did not. I have seen him grow in the organization but I strongly believe he deserves more. His calm and composed personality makes most complex of situations, much easier. detailed_profile.name: Vishesh Bansal
detailed_profile.position: Associate Leadership Team- Startup Engagement & Innovation at ICICI Bank | Innovation 40 under Forty | Artificial Intelligence | Gen AI
detailed_profile.about: A dedicated, outcome-oriented professional with focus on enhancing customer centric businesses and products. Over the last 10 years, I have developed and nurtured extensive skills across industries like BFSI, Automotive and IT. In my current role, I drive innovations and partnerships in close collaboration with startups, incubators, academic institutions and industry partners to capitalize on the emerging opportunities in the Fintech ecosystem. My current objectives include landscape analysis in focused areas like Artificial Intelligence, Lending, Fintech solutions to identify strategic players, market opportunities and partnership avenues. Also, to develop a value proposition and business model in collaboration with business teams to engage with Startup for rapid prototyping, successful PoC and subsequent roll out. I have been a part of many industry-first and award winning initiatives like E-ADR (Independent Institutional E-Arbitration platform, on recommendations of Ministry of Law & Justice, Govt. of India), Contract Automation System for ICICI Bank and Interactive Voice Response(IVR) Automation for ICICI Bank. Innovation Management | Startup Engagement | Digital Strategy | Product Management | Business Analysis | Project Management | Stakeholder Management

HR Function & Internal Recruitments
-To handle Overall functions of HR Vertical
-Take over head hunting, talent acquisition/recruitment for various open positions for the company
-Being responsible for employee on boarding and conduction employee orientation and induction programs for new joiners

Student Placements:

- Responsible to source and on-board new companies on a regular basis having requirement for Digital marketing and Data Science Positions.
- Liaison between corporate HR and students to schedule interviews and responsible to successfully place students in reputed organization

Training
- Conduct Interview skills workshops and groom student and prepare them for Interview
- Mock interviews with students, One on One session for grooming.

projects.title: Project Mindforge
projects.description: Appointed as ICICI Bank‚Äôs official SPOC to MAS‚Äôs cross-institutional taskforce on AI risk governance, contributing directly to Singapore‚Äôs national framework for secure and responsible AI adoption in financial services.Working alongside regulators, peer banks, and legal experts to co-develop principles-based controls that promote ethical, explainable, and accountable AI in banking systems.I provide operational and compliance insights to MAS on emerging risks tied to AI models‚Äîcovering areas such as data integrity, customer transparency, and bias mitigation‚Äîto ensure alignment with upcoming regulatory standards.Internally, I lead impact assessments and readiness exercises across compliance, operations, and digital teams to prepare ICICI Bank for AI-specific audit, assurance, and governance expectations.

projects.title: Trade Finance Registery implementation
projects.description: Represented ICICI Bank as a core founding member of Singapore‚Äôs first centralized Trade Finance Registry (bit.ly/abs-tfr), under the leadership of the Association of Banks in Singapore (ABS), from April 2023 to June 2024.Collaborated with ABS and peer banks to design and validate key control points that ensure compliance with Singapore‚Äôs regulatory, legal, and operational framework‚Äîtargeting double financing risks and boosting transaction transparency.Led internal system integration and UAT across ICICI‚Äôs trade finance platforms, enabling a smooth go-live with 100% success in data reporting and cross-bank reconciliation.The initiative has already driven a 20% reduction in trade finance fraud and a 25% boost in processing efficiency‚Äîhighlighting its impact on industry-wide trust, transparency, and operational risk mitigation.

projects.title: MEPS+ ISO 20022 Implementation
projects.description: Led ICICI Bank‚Äôs operational transition to ISO 20022 for MEPS+ transactions (bit.ly/mas-meps), one of the earliest such migrations globally, under the directive of the Singapore Clearing House from January 2022 to August 2023.Acted as the bank-wide lead, overseeing change management and positioning Singapore‚Äôs migration model as a benchmark for replication across other ICICI global branches.Directed cross-functional integration across operations, compliance, and technology, achieving 100% message validation accuracy and a 30% increase in processing speed post-migration.Worked closely with central clearing teams, MAS, and SWIFT stakeholders to deliver a zero-impact cutover, managing UAT cycles, system readiness reviews, and compliance testing across RTGS and in-house banking systems.Drove 90%+ user readiness through targeted enablement programs and structured post-go-live support‚Äîensuring continuity, regulatory alignment, and scalability under the new ISO 20022 messaging standards.

projects.title: App based Integrated account Opening for Students in Canada
projects.description: Chaired and led one of ICICI Bank Canada‚Äôs most strategic and groundbreaking initiatives‚Äîthe launch of an App-based Integrated Account Opening platform tailored for international students arriving in Canada under the Student Partners Program (SPP).This first-of-its-kind digital onboarding solution was built to streamline pre-arrival banking for Indian students, enabling them to open accounts, upload documents, and receive account details and GIC (Guaranteed Investment Certificate) confirmation‚Äîall before landing in Canada.‚Ä¢Designed and delivered a fully mobile-first onboarding experience, integrating KYC, document verification, GIC booking, and debit card issuance into a single flow.‚Ä¢Collaborated with ICICI Canada, legal, compliance, and technology teams to ensure end-to-end regulatory readiness and cross-border operational alignment.‚Ä¢Developed secure APIs and backend integrations with Canadian banking systems, ensuring seamless processing and onboarding.‚Ä¢Enabled faster turnaround, reduced manual interventions, and provided unparalleled convenience, helping ICICI Bank Canada gain significant market share among Indian students.The platform became a cornerstone for the bank‚Äôs international retail growth, cementing ICICI‚Äôs reputation as a tech-forward, customer-first institution in the Canadian market.

projects.title: Instant Service Channel for UK customers in Retail Internet Banking
projects.description: Led the development and launch of ICICI Bank UK‚Äôs first Instant Processing Platform‚Äîa transformative initiative designed to digitize and automate retail customer service requests, significantly enhancing customer experience and operational efficiency.This platform introduced real-time processing for a wide range of customer requests, including account updates, statement generation, debit card services, cheque book issuance, and transactional queries, which previously relied on manual intervention or delayed batch cycles.‚Ä¢Architected the end-to-end workflow by integrating core banking systems, CRM, and document management platforms to enable straight-through processing.‚Ä¢Collaborated with UK compliance, operations, and technology teams to ensure regulatory alignment while driving automation across request types.‚Ä¢Introduced auto-verification mechanisms, digital request tracking, and customer confirmation features, improving service transparency and reducing TAT by over 70%.‚Ä¢Enabled a single-window interface for service teams, reducing errors, boosting productivity, and delivering consistent service quality across all UK retail branches and digital touchpoints.The initiative marked a milestone in ICICI Bank UK‚Äôs retail transformation journey, establishing a scalable, digital-first service delivery model that positioned the bank as a leader in customer-centric innovation in the UK market.

projects.title: Global Core Banking System Migration ‚Äì FINNACLE 7.4 to 10.2
projects.description: Spearheaded the enterprise-wide migration of ICICI Bank‚Äôs core banking platform from FINNACLE 7.4 to 10.2 across all international branches, covering geographies such as Singapore, UAE, UK, Canada, Bahrain, and the US.This critical initiative aimed at modernizing the bank‚Äôs technology backbone to support regulatory agility, enhanced transaction processing, real-time reporting, and seamless integration with emerging digital services.‚Ä¢Led the entire program lifecycle‚Äîfrom impact analysis, solution design, and data migration strategy to execution, post-migration stabilization, and audit readiness.‚Ä¢Coordinated with Infosys, in-country regulators, and internal business teams to ensure compliance with local operational mandates while standardizing the global platform.‚Ä¢Achieved 100% data integrity and a zero-defect cutover across all entities, with no disruption to customer services during transition.‚Ä¢Enabled improved processing speed, scalability, and system uptime, laying the groundwork for future digital transformation initiatives.‚Ä¢Delivered a future-proof platform supporting multi-currency, multi-entity operations with advanced risk and compliance controls integrated natively.The success of this multi-country rollout positioned ICICI Bank‚Äôs international operations on a modernized, unified core, enabling faster product launches, stronger compliance alignment, and improved customer experience globally.

projects.title: FATCA Deployment for International Private Banking Customers
projects.description: Led one of ICICI Bank Singapore‚Äôs most critical compliance transformation initiatives‚Äîthe deployment of FATCA (Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act) standards for e-private banking customers, aligning with U.S. IRS mandates and MAS regulatory expectations.This initiative ensured end-to-end FATCA compliance across the private banking portfolio, including client onboarding, due diligence, reporting, and certification, safeguarding the bank against cross-border regulatory and reputational risks.‚Ä¢Spearheaded the comprehensive system enablement to capture, validate, and report FATCA-relevant data for all high-net-worth international customers.‚Ä¢Built automation logic for US indicia identification, client self-certification, and reporting data extraction, ensuring a seamless and accurate compliance flow.‚Ä¢Integrated FATCA modules with the core private banking system and CRM, eliminating manual touchpoints and reducing processing errors.‚Ä¢Collaborated with tax advisory, legal, and technology teams to establish a robust governance and audit trail, ready for IRS and MAS scrutiny.‚Ä¢Delivered 100% timely and accurate reporting for the first cycle with zero audit observations, establishing a strong compliance foundation for cross-border wealth management operations.The project played a pivotal role in strengthening the regulatory integrity and operational credibility of ICICI Bank‚Äôs Singapore private banking business

projects.title: Development of a New Private Banking System for seamless execution of private Banking Investment products
projects.description: Led the design and implementation of a next-generation Private Banking system, delivering a seamless digital experience for high-net-worth clients across investment products and advisory services.The system integrated core modules for Private Equity, Alternate Investment Funds, and Margin Lending, enabling end-to-end execution, tracking, and reporting within a unified platform. This removed fragmentation across legacy systems and enhanced operational control and speed.A comprehensive Customer Relationship Management (CRM) module was developed to centralize critical data‚Äîincluding client demographics, risk appetite, and investment preferences‚Äîwith full integration to product subscription workflows. This provided a 360-degree view of client portfolios, improving personalization and cross-sell opportunities.The platform featured an embedded Financial Fact Finding (FFF) module and an Investment Attitude Questionnaire, supporting client profiling, suitability checks, and regulatory compliance. These tools ensured investment advisory processes were aligned with the client‚Äôs goals and risk profile, strengthening both transparency and trust.The solution served as a one-stop platform for all private banking needs, streamlining front-to-back workflows and significantly improving relationship manager productivity, client experience, and compliance alignment.

projects.title: New system development for automation of the Customer Due diligence and KYC for Private banking customers
projects.description: Led the development and deployment of a compliance-centric automation platform for Customer Due Diligence (CDD) and KYC processes tailored specifically for Private Banking customers‚Äîa key initiative to elevate regulatory adherence, operational efficiency, and customer risk transparency.The system was designed to enable real-time customer risk profiling and proactive CDD/KYC management, serving as a critical tool for both onboarding and ongoing surveillance.‚Ä¢Developed a rule-based engine to auto-trigger CDD and KYC remediation workflows for existing clients, ensuring timely and compliant action by relationship managers.‚Ä¢Enabled seamless capture of onboarding due diligence through both sales and operations interfaces, creating a unified compliance process across functions.‚Ä¢Implemented real-time customer risk grading using a weighted average scoring model, factoring in transactional behavior, geography, product usage, and external risk indicators.‚Ä¢Delivered a 360-degree compliance view of each client, accessible to relationship managers, improving transparency and informed decision-making at the front line.‚Ä¢Integrated alert escalation, documentation checks, and regulatory flags into a single workflow, significantly reducing manual oversight and missed reviews.This initiative positioned ICICI‚Äôs Private Banking division at the forefront of risk-aligned customer management, demonstrating how tech-led compliance solutions can drive both governance strength and client confidence.

projects.title: Private Banking Customer Realignment ‚Äì Individualization of Joint Customer Records
projects.description: Led a strategically significant compliance and system enhancement project for ICICI Bank Singapore‚Äôs Private Banking division, aimed at realigning joint customer structures to synchronize with Singapore‚Äôs regulatory and operational expectations for customer-level transparency.This initiative was critical in transitioning from account-level data aggregation to individualized customer information capture, supporting better risk profiling, KYC compliance, and regulatory disclosures under MAS guidelines.‚Ä¢Conducted an exhaustive risk and control analysis, and authored a formal Approach Document detailing the framework for joint-to-individual customer data separation.‚Ä¢Automated the entire realignment process within the core banking system, eliminating manual touchpoints and reducing execution time by over 75%.‚Ä¢Ensured that all Private Banking joint accounts were mapped to uniquely identifiable customer profiles, enabling precise due diligence, risk scoring, and reporting.‚Ä¢Strengthened ICICI Bank Singapore‚Äôs compliance posture by aligning internal records with MAS‚Äôs evolving CDD and KYC standards.‚Ä¢Improved visibility and audit readiness for individual customer risk, forming a foundation for future onboarding and product personalization initiatives.This project was a foundational compliance upgrade for ICICI Singapore , ensuring both regulatory alignment and process modernization in one of the bank‚Äôs most sensitive customer segments.

projects.title: FCRM on AIR Launched for entire ICICI Bank
projects.description: Conceptualized and led the deployment of a low-bandwidth version of ICICI Bank‚Äôs FCRM (Financial Customer Relationship Management) suite, enabling secure access over internet-connected devices‚Äîwell ahead of mainstream app integrations or remote work norms in banking.Launched in August 2014, this path-breaking solution allowed real-time, on-the-go access to the bank‚Äôs CRM capabilities for sales and relationship managers, significantly transforming frontline customer engagement.‚Ä¢Enabled FCRM login and transaction capture over public internet‚Äîno VPN or office LAN required‚Äîwhile maintaining full compliance with data security standards.‚Ä¢Empowered the entire sales force to initiate, track, and fulfill customer requests from anywhere, ensuring faster turnaround and an improved service experience.‚Ä¢Marked a first-of-its-kind digital enablement in the Indian banking ecosystem, introducing agility into customer servicing long before remote banking operations became the norm.‚Ä¢The project received bank-level recognition and was nominated for the EFMA‚ÄìAccenture Distribution & Marketing Innovation Awards 2014, underscoring its industry relevance and innovation.FCRM on Air became a critical enabler for field teams, laying the foundation for future mobility solutions and remote-first relationship management‚Äîa visionary step that anticipated today‚Äôs flexible, tech-driven banking environment.

projects.title: Implementation of the transactional monitoring rules and automation of alert monitoring by integration of name scanning software with the core banking system
projects.description: Steered one of ICICI Bank‚Äôs most critical compliance automation initiatives‚Äîthe end-to-end implementation of transaction monitoring rules and alert automation, aligned with AML/CFT regulatory frameworks and global best practices.This project aimed to build a robust, real-time surveillance mechanism to detect and prevent suspicious activities across customer transactions, while minimizing manual intervention and ensuring consistent rule enforcement.‚Ä¢Designed and deployed a comprehensive set of risk-based monitoring rules, tailored to customer profiles, product types, geographies, and behavioral triggers.‚Ä¢Led the integration of name screening software with the core banking system, automating checks for sanctioned entities, PEPs, and high-risk associations at the transaction level.‚Ä¢Enabled real-time alert generation and prioritization, significantly improving turnaround time for compliance reviews and reducing false positives.‚Ä¢Coordinated with compliance, operations, and IT teams to ensure seamless deployment and end-user readiness for system adoption.‚Ä¢The solution ensured full alignment with FATF, RBI, and global AML guidelines, enhancing the bank‚Äôs overall surveillance capability and audit preparedness.

projects.title: Business Continuity Site setup at Hyderabad
projects.description: Part of the core team responsible for establishing ICICI Bank‚Äôs Business Continuity Management (BCM) site in Hyderabad, aimed at ensuring operational resilience for critical banking services.‚Ä¢Supported the end-to-end setup of infrastructure, systems, and contingency processes for Retail and Corporate Operations.‚Ä¢Collaborated with technology, facilities, and risk teams to define failover protocols, disaster recovery measures, and alternate workflows.‚Ä¢Played a key role in testing and activation exercises, ensuring readiness for operational shift in case of disruption at primary locations.‚Ä¢The site became one of the bank‚Äôs earliest and most robust continuity hubs, laying the foundation for long-term risk management and business resilience planning.
